=== Kubuntu Update ===

=== UNE update ===

* Double dose of sweetness with 2 unity releases! and multiple uploads to some components :)
* More than 40 bugs were fixed last week, we gain support for a lot of things and no known crashers as of today!
* Of course, due to a crasher we needed to transition from libindicate0 to libindicate1 which we enjoyed a lot, but all went well after all. :-)
* RC is coming, iso testing is needed! thanks to everyone who wants to help there.
* I'm particularly interested from people who don't have graphical acceleration as the UNE session should not warn you about it, and once you validate, you should be logged out of the session and the desktop session should be set as a default.
* still some issues known with shotwell, should be fixed by eow

=== USC update ===

* Software Center version 3.0 was released!

* Buy Something
** the team restrictions for test purchases has been lifted and the $1 test package is available to all
** folks are buying the package and we are getting very valuable feedback and bug reports
** continued great bug fixes on the server side
** continued testing and bug fixing in Software Center
  
* New Apps on a Stable Release
** extras.ubuntu.com key is added to ubuntu-extras-keyring
** all of the pieces are in place for new apps
** we currently have three Application Review Requests in the queue
   
* Miscellaneous
** lots of testing, targeted bugfixing
** currently we have 4 open bugs targeted for 10.10

==== Till Kamppeter (tkamppeter) ====

* foomatic-db, gutenprint, hplip, splix, ptouch-driver: Built the compressed PPD archives with pyppd 0.4.9. This way runtime errors with traceback are avoided when thge self-extracting archive gets killed by Ctrl+C or by a broken pipe when the program collecting the PPD file/PPD list output of the archive gets canceled (LP: #618017).
* gutenprint: Fixed LP: #647369. CUPS-dependent steps in the post-install script must wait for the CUPS daemon getting ready after restart.
* cups: Discussed some problems of the upstartification with pitti so that pitti could fix some last-minute bugs.
